snippet: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, has faced recent criticism as potential rivals gain endorsements, suggesting that name recognition also makes her a more inviting target.
abstract: New York City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn, after months of maintaining a cool, above-the-fray approach to the 2013 mayoral race, is facing her first bumps of what may be a pockmarked road to the Democratic primary; she has faced recent criticism as potential rivals gain endorsements, signaling that front-runner status can be ephemeral and, sometimes, a liability.
lead_paragraph: Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, has faced recent criticism as potential rivals gain endorsements, suggesting that name recognition also makes her a more inviting target.

headline.seo: Perceived Front-Runner for Mayor Sees Hints of a Steeper Road to Victory
headline.main: Hints at Steeper Road to Victory for Perceived Front-Runner in Mayor’s Race
headline.print_headline: Hints at Steeper Road to Victory for Perceived Front-Runner in Mayor’s Race
